summary: An individual's internal dissatisfaction can lead them to question and abandon what they have, in pursuit of an idealized version of happiness.
The portrayal of love in fiction can create unrealistic expectations, causing individuals to seek something that may not exist in reality.
Upon reflection, an individual may realize the value of what they lost, experiencing profound regret for having pursued an illusion over genuine contentment.
Through experiences and introspection, an individual can come to understand the true nature of love and happiness, recognizing the depth of what they once had.
